alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 11 at 3:32PM CDT until May 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS BEEN ISSUED FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In NEZ210...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. * Winds...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts over 35 mph Thursday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent Thursday. * Temperatures...In the upper 80s Thursday. * Impacts...Weather conditions will be favorable for rapid fire growth and erratic fire behavior. Fires may quickly become out of control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
